Career Profile

I am a PhD student at School of Computing, National University of Singapore, under supervision of Associate Professor Chin Wei-Ngan. My interests are program verification, software analysis and separation logic.

Publications

  • Xuan-Bach Le, Thanh-Toan Nguyen, Wei-Ngan Chin, and Aquinas Hobor. A Certified Decision Procedure for Tree Shares. In ICFEM, 2017.

Experiences

Teaching Assistant

2017
School of Computing, National University of Singapore.
  • CS4215 - Programming Language Implementation, AY 2016/2017 Semester 2.
  • CS4212 - Compiler Design, AY 2017/2018 Semester 1.

Research Assistant

7/2015 - 7/2016
School of Computing, National University of Singapore.

I worked on HIP/SLEEK and Fixpoint projects, under Associate Professor Chin Wei-Ngan. We targeted building an automatic verifier for programs using separation logic.

Intern student

1/2015 - 3/2015
JAIST, Japan

I investigated the problem of building symbolic execution for higher-order languages like Python or Lua. At JAIST, I joined Aoki lab, under Professor Toshiaki Aoki.

Partime Software Developer

4/2014 - 10/2014
FPT Software, Vietnam

I joined a research project about object recognision using OpenCV with Japanese customer NTT-IT.

Projects

HIP/SLEEK - An automatic verification system for heap manipulating programs
